subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Way/Why
msgSnippet: ... I might say it has two standard pronunciations , insofar as e.g. both the Concise Oxford and the American Heritage give phonetic respellings which are
messageBody:
On 22 Feb 2013, at 03:37, John Cowan <cowan@...> wrote:

> You can avoid local vocabulary, but you can't avoid a local pronunciation.
> Standard English does not have a standard pronunciation, unlike Standard
> French or Standard German.

I might say it has two "standard pronunciations", insofar as e.g. both the Concise Oxford and the American Heritage give phonetic respellings which are intended to have some accuracy.

Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
